page.title: 04Places Of Interest 3
page.content: {The Almshouses}are to be found behind St.Mary Magdalene Church.The main building was built in 1368 by John De Cobham.The foundation was disolved in 1539-40.It was uninhabited until 1596. In 1956 the almshouses were refurbished,but there were only sixteen flats then.Each flat has one bedroom,one sitting room,one bathroom and central heating.The almhouses are run by a trust called Rochester Trust Fund.Pensioners apply to live there.In 1981 they were completely restored.The almshouses have more than sixteen flats nowadays.
